item.title: 9 Changes That Demon Slayer Hinokami Chronicles 2 Should Make
item.description:
Summary

  • Demon Slayer: Hinokami Chronicles 2 plans to revamp gameplay through improvements, focusing on better balance for characters.
  • The sequel should introduce more extra modes for varied fun, including a shop for outfits and profile accessories.
  • Accessibility improvements like additional controller options and up to four-player matches in versus mode are crucial for broadening the audience.

Demon Slayer: Kimetsu No Yaibu- Hinokami Chronicles perfectly implements Demon Slayer characters in a Naruto Ultimate Ninja Storm format. It grew along with the hype of Demon Slayer , earning over 3 million sales across all platforms. This success was enough for the developers to support the sequel with its recent announcement.

Demon Slayer: Kimetsu No Yaibu- Hinokami Chronicles 2 is picking up where the predecessor left off. Rather than conjuring up more DLC, the developers have plans to revamp the gameplay with improvements. The developers showed their passion through Demon Slayer: Kimetsu No Yaibu- Hinokami Chronicles balancing, which gives some hope for how the sequel will change for its benefit.

9 Team Ultimates

Teamwork Is Key

An ultimate skill is a great option to plow through the opponent’s health or end a combo. In the first game, each fighter only had one ultimate skill, which grew stronger in tangent with the amount of saved super meter. An improvement for supers would be team ultimates.

Naruto Ultimate Ninja Storm allowed designated ninjas to use team ultimate jutsus to showcase the characters’ relationships. Demon Slayer: Kimetsu No Yaibu- Hinokami Chronicles 2 can follow that format, which could create some engaging or humorous interactions during the flow of battle. This would be more suitable for demon slayers, since they utilize teamwork for better efficiency.

8 Extra Modes

More Fun, The Better

Extra modes are perfect to provide more varied fun for the Demon Slayer fans. The first game was limited to story and versus modes, making the casual experience barebones. This can be fixed by including more casual modes that involve doing randomized missions to hunt fighters, surviving waves of demons, or playing through arcade mode.

Another great inclusion would be a shop to buy outfits or possible profile accessories with Kimetsu points. The shop can even include daily or weekly missions to encourage longer playtime while updating the stocks at certain intervals.

7 Character Balancing

Leveling The Fight

Balance changes are extremely important to help fighting games last longer. The roster in the first Demon Slayer: Kimetsu No Yaibu- Hinokami Chronicles felt very viable, but some tweaks are needed to level the characters’ potential, especially the top tiers. The stronger fighters shouldn’t be nerfed to the ground, but should leveled enough for other characters to stand a chance.

The combat should become less campy, especially with armored attacks. Super armor discourages interaction, rendering weaker fighters unable to challenge demons with armored zoning tools. It felt too early for the predecessor to end its balance updates, so hopefully there are still support plans for the sequel.

6 Clones

Creative Fighters

The Kimetsu Academy fighters are unique additions that slightly changed some of the current fighters in the game. The only differences are their attack sounds, costumes, and ultimate skill. They’re welcoming additions, but they feel more like extra costumes rather than lone fighters.

If more of these echo fighters appear for other characters, they should be more distinct. They can stay reminiscent of their inspired sources, but should feature more unique fighting styles like new skills, features, or new combo routes. Their attribute stats can even change, since they fight with different weapons, like Zenitsu’s broom or Tanjiro’s wooden sword, making them strong and weak with certain moves.

5 Customization

Hunt In Style

Customization is an essential addition for the growing roster. of over 40 characters. The original game had minimal options for most of the cast, except for specific characters like Tanjiro and Giyu. The demons had no costume options at all, but only one alternate color like everyone else.

This issue can be easily solved by including at least three alternate colors for each fighter. A more effective option would be adding customization slots. Letting fans dress their fighters in accessories similar to Dragon Ball Xenoverse 2 will encourage players to stay committed to better fashion.

4 Accessibility

Freedom To Fight

Accessibility is always good to include for fighting games. Demon Slayer: Kimetsu No Yaibu- Hinokami Chronicles isn’t complicated, though its skill mechanics provide some depth with webs of combos. More controller options would welcome a broader audience, while giving variety for ideal control schemes.

Versus mode should provide more variety by allowing up to four players to engage in a match. It can play similarly to My Hero One’s Justice 2 , allowing the supporting teammate to control support attacks while the active partner battles. This would be locked to demon slayers since they’re the most suitable for working together in pairs, unlike demons.

3 Online

Connected Realms

Online play is a significant standard for player commitment in fighting games. The sequel shouldn't just include rank and standard matchmaking, but also include lobbies and options for casual play. There can even be events for players to participate with eligible fighters for rewards, like in Super Smash Bros Ultimate online tournaments.

Crossplay is another factor that would lengthen the game's lifespan. Locking the community of players on different consoles can send the wrong message, diminishing player commitment.

2 New Interactions

Altered Attacks

The character with the most unique interactions in Demon Slayer: Kimetsu No Yaibu- Hinokami Chronicles is Kimetsu Academy Zenitsu. His ultimate skill makes him judge his opponents' clothes before engaging them with a grade. While he gets scared of weapons from both demon slayers and demons, he goes head over heels for cute human girls like Makomo and Nezuko.

It would be best for more fighters to have ultimate skills with certain requirements to change the move’s outcome. It would make the match more lively to see certain fighters react differently to specific opponents, like Tanjiro and Obanai. This can also include demons that fight specific hashiras, showing their intense resentment.

1 Improved Support

Longer Change To Flourish

Developer support felt lackluster in the first Demon Slayer: Kimetsu No Yaibu- Hinokami Chronicles . It launched with only demon slayers, and the actual demons were added later in its lifespan. The most beneficial choice for the sequel’s launch is to include every necessary demon from the remaining Demon Slayer anime arcs.

Since the game is covering the Hashira training arc, its post-launch support can get more creative. The most suitable additions could include more unique characters, like Muzan’s upper-rank demons shown in the spotlight or the manipulative, shapeshifting leader himself. It would be a win-win to add characters from the Infinity Castle arc for player interest and anime promotion.

item.title: Dragon Quest 3 Remake: Maw of the Necrogond Walkthrough (Silver Orb)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Mt. Necrogond Volcano Walkthrough – Dragon Quest 3 Remake
  • Maw of the Necrogond B1 Walkthrough – Dragon Quest 3 Remake
  • Maw of the Necrogond L1 Walkthrough – Dragon Quest 3 Remake
  • Maw of the Necrogond L2 Walkthrough – Dragon Quest 3 Remake
  • Maw of the Necrogond L3 Walkthrough – Dragon Quest 3 Remake
  • Maw of the Necrogond L4 Walkthrough – Dragon Quest 3 Remake
  • Maw of the Necrogond L5 Walkthrough – Dragon Quest III Remake
  • Necrogond Shrine Walkthrough – Dragon Quest 3 Remake
  • All Monsters in the Maw of the Necrogond – Dragon Quest 3 Remake

After collecting five of the game's colored orbs, Dragon Quest 3 Remake players will have to turn their gaze to Mt. Necrogond v olcano , and make their way into the Maw of the Necrogond. This long series of encounters and dungeons will ultimately lead players to the Silver Orb , which will likely be the final orb players' collect before unlocking Ramia the Everbird .

The Maw of the Necrogond is the main dungeon DQIII Remake players will have to complete in order to collect the sixth and final orb. This massive complex is situated right in the middle of two smaller – yet equally important – encounters. The first is Mt. Necrogond volcano , which ultimately unlocks the path to the Maw of the Necrogond. The second is the Necrogond Shrine , where players will receive the Silver Orb. In this guide, we will walk you through each area, and explain how to get the Silver Orb in Dragon Quest 3 Remake,

Mt. Necrogond Volcano Walkthrough – Dragon Quest 3 Remake

The first event you'll need to complete in order to get the Silver Orb is the Volcano . Before entering this area, you will have to acquire the Mountaincleaver from the Shrine of Shackles . Once the sword is in your possession, it'll be time to scale the mountain and face the Garboyle . After you gather the Mountaincleaver, the game should direct you to Mt. Necrogond volcano – AKA the fiery mountain – as your next task.

How to Reach Mt. Necrogond:

To reach Mt. Necrogond , you'll want to sail west from Baharata. As you sail west, check the map for a small river inlet to the north. It will be just after a small desert area. Make your way up the river, then turn left when the river splits. At the end of this small river section, you'll want to get off the ship and walk the short distance to Mt. Necrogond.

The volcano actually entails only one real encounter: the Garboyle main boss.

How to Defeat Garboyle in Dragon Quest 3 Remake:

Garboyle is a very powerful boss who uses a variety of attacks. It is capable of performing three attacks per turn , which can be devastating, even to appropriately leveled characters. In our fight, which was at the Dragon Quest difficulty level, Garboyle used four main attacks:

  • Attack Attacker: This brutal attack not only does massive damage, but will lower the attack power of whomever it hits.
  • Frizzle : A mid-level fire-based spell.
  • Burning Breath : A dangerous cloud attack that is capable of inflicting paralysis on all party members.
  • Dazzle: A spell that is capable of confusing the party, making you lose control of whomever is affected.

The most important pieces of Equipment for this fight are those that can help stop Paralysis and Confusion. The Banishing Bell is a good accessory for protecting against both at the same time. Check your Equipment bag for any gear that protects against these status effects.

Garboyle has two major weaknesses : Crack -based spells (Ice) and Zap -based spells (Electricity).

The Hero will want to use Zapple or Lightning Slash. If you have at least one spell-caster, Kacrack should be available at this point. We had two spell-casters, but made the mistake of focusing too much on attacks. You definitely want at least one party-member to be dedicated to healing.

In many ways, Garboyle is one of the most significant skill checks in Dragon Quest 3 Remake. While we were able to defeat it on our first attempt, only our Hero survived the fight. In hindsight, the better strategy would have been to focus two party members on attacks, and keep two party members back in a supporting role. It would have taken longer to win, but the entire party would have had a better chance of surviving.

After defeating Garboyle, don't forget to head to the NW corner of the trail on Mt. Necrogond to find one of Dragon Quest 3 Remake 's two Magmalice Friendly Monsters. It will either be Alice or Bernie, depending on what order you find them in.

After you defeat Garboyle, a special cutscene will play that will give you more insight into Ortega's character. Avoiding major spoilers, it is enough to say that the fight will result in a new path being formed that will allow you to proceed to the Maw of the Necrogond .

Maw of the Necrogond B1 Walkthrough – Dragon Quest 3 Remake

How to Reach the Maw of the Necrogond:

After defeating the Garboyle, Mt. Necrogond will erupt, creating a path of volcanic rock that allows you to reach the Maw of the Necrogond. If you check the map, you'll see a long, skinny path that leads south between the snow-covered mountains. At the end of the path, you'll find the dungeon's entrance.

About two-thirds of the way down the path you'll encounter poisonous purple areas that harm the party if they walk through them. Use the Safe Passage spell to safely enter and collect the sparkly loot cache.

Near the southern end of the path, before you turn west to enter the cave, you'll notice there is a Secret Spot on a raised plateau. You can only reach this area once you've unlocked Ramia the Everbird . The Secret Spot contains a Stealth Suit and a Thief's Turban .

Maw of the Necrogond B1 Main Path:

When you enter the Maw of the Necrogond, you'll start on the first basement level, or B1 . There aren't any significant events that happen on the first level. You'll simply cross the bridge and climb the stairs that leads to the first main level, or L1 .

Maw of the Necrogond L1 Walkthrough – Dragon Quest 3 Remake

Maw of the Necrogond L1 Main Path:

The first main level is where the dungeon begins in earnest. You'll enter the floor in the southeast corner, and you'll ultimately need to reach the southwest corner. Between these two points, you'll face many difficult foes, many of which you will not have seen yet.

The main route along L1 stays on the lower section of the map. You can see above the easiest path through the area. However, if you want to collect all four pieces of treasure, you'll have to explore.

All Treasure on Maw of the Necrogond L1:

  • Treasure 1: Full Moon Ring
  • Treasure 2: Thunderbolt Blade
  • Treasure 3: Sage's Elixir
  • Treasure 4: Spiked Armor

Maw of the Necrogond L2 Walkthrough – Dragon Quest 3 Remake

Maw of the Necrogond L2 Main Path:

The second level of the maw has multiple regions, with multiple maps covering them. When you first reach L2 and look at the map, you'll see two exits; the first exit is on the northeastern side, and the second is on the southeastern side, past the areas with large holes.

The main path leads to the southeastern exit, which takes you to L3. The first exit, on the right side of the loop, takes you to another section of L2 (we'll call it L2-B). This extended area is actually a path that will simply loop if you continue to head east. There is a Friendly Monster in this section, so it is worth visiting.

When you return to L2-A, make your way down past the large holes in the ground. If you fall in one of the holes, you'll end up back on L1. Make your way up the ladder in the southeast corner to reach L3.

There is a third section, L2-C, that you can only reach from L3, so it will be included in that section.

All Treasure in Maw of Necrogond L2:

L2-A:

  • Treasure 1: Angel Bell

L2-B:

  • Treasure 1: This chest is a Mimic

Maw of the Necrogond L3 Walkthrough – Dragon Quest 3 Remake

Maw of the Necrogond L3 Main Path:

The third level of the Maw of the Necrogond is a bit tricky, as you must drop to a lower level in order to reach the exit to L4. If you check the map, you'll see a path that leads across the center of the area. At the end of that path across the center, there is a drop. You want to fall into this drop to reach L2-C, which is the only way to reach the right part of L3.

On L2-C, you can see that there is a north exit and a south exit. The south exit will take you to the lower route on L3 that leads to Treasure 2. The northern exit will take you to the northeastern route on L3, which will lead to the exit to L4.

When you reach the NE route on L3, look for the shrine just before the exit. Step inside to refill your party's HP and MP.

All Treasure on Maw of the Necrogond L3 and L2-C:

L2-C:

  • Treasure 1: Assassin's Dagger
  • Treasure 2: Mini Medal
  • Treasure 3: Black Bandanna

L3:

  • Treasure 1: 3, 024 Gold Coins
  • Treasure 2: Mythril Helm

Maw of the Necrogond L4 Walkthrough – Dragon Quest 3 Remake

Maw of the Necrogond L4 Main Path:

The fourth level of the Maw of the Necrogond is the last normal dungeon floor, and it is absolutely massive. Check our map for the actual main path through the level, as that is the best way to learn it.

Because the chamber is so big, you will have an unusually high number of encounters before reaching the exit. This is a good place to use either Holy Protection from the Hero, or Padfoot from a Thief. Using either or both spells will make it much easier to get through the chamber quickly.

All Treasure on Maw of the Necrogond L4:

  • Treasure 1: Magic Shield
  • Treasure 2: Magical Robes
  • Treasure 3: Phial of Magic Water
  • Treasure 4: This treasure is a Mimic
  • Treasure 5: Yggdasil Leaf
  • Treasure 6: Thinking Cap

Maw of the Necrogond L5 Walkthrough – Dragon Quest III Remake

The final floor of the Maw of the Necrogond is simply a bridge that leads outside to the Necrogond Shrine.

Necrogond Shrine Walkthrough – Dragon Quest 3 Remake

After you exit the Maw of the Necrogond , you'll want to head east until you see a small church on top of a hill. This is the Necrogond Shrine . Head inside the shrine and speak to the NPC – they cannot be missed.

There are three treasures at the Necrogond Shrine :

  1. Outside the shrine, on the eastern side, you'll find a barrel containing a Dragon Scale.
  2. Inside the shrine , check the area behind the NPC. You'll find two buried treasures, the first being one of DQIII Remake 's Mini Medals, the next being a Seed of Life.

Speaking to the NPC will automatically award you with the final orb, the Silver Orb.

Now that you have all six orbs, you will be able to head to Rimland, where the Shrine of the Everbird awaits. Unlocking the Everbird is the only way to reach the lair of the Archfiend Baramos .

item.title: Stalker 2: How To Fix the "Help Solder" Objective Bug In The Hornet's Nest Mission
item.description:
Solder is the one who sold Skif the coordinates to place the scanner at the start of Stalker 2: Heart of Chornobyl . After tracking him down at the Sphere during the "Behind Seven Seals" mission, you'll be presented with the choice to either spare or kill Solder. If you choose to spare his life, he'll show up again and assist you during the mission "The Hornet's Nest."

However, the objective "Help Solder" seems to be bugged in the game, even if you save him from Monolithian soldiers. The object isn't marked as complete, and in some instances, he even ends up dying out of nowhere. This can be a bit frustrating, but there's a quick workaround you can do to successfully help Solder and mark the object as complete during the Hornet's Nest in Stalker 2 .

How to Fix the "Help Solder" Bug During Hornet's Nest Mission

When you start The Hornet's Nest in Stalker 2 , you'll meet Solder at the start of the mission (if you've spared his life in the Behind Seven Seals mission). When Monolithian soldiers are targeting him, you can kill the two soldiers immediately. However, it won't mark the "Help Soldier" objective as complete. Here's the proper way to do it.

Enter the Room Where Solder Is

​​​​​As soon as you step into the corridor, Solder's radio transmission will begin requesting assistance against the Noontide/Monolith soldiers. As soon as you hear the broadcast, rush into the room where Solder is making his stand against enemies.

Listen to Solder Complete Radio Transmission First

Once you enter the room, there's a high chance that the Monolithian soldiers will shift their aggro from Solder onto Skif, which is exactly what you want. In case that doesn't happen, simply shoot a single bullet in both of their legs to make them shoot you instead. This step is crucial in preventing the Monolithians from killing off Solder while you're waiting for his transmission to end.

Take Down the Monolith Soldiers

Once Solder's transmission ends, the mission pop-up will indicate that you need to "Help Solder." When that happens, now you can track down both of the Monolithian soldiers attacking Solder and take them down. Once both of the enemies are down, approach Solder and start a conversation with him.

This will successfully mark the sub-objective as complete. Solder will stay alive, and you can carry on completing other optional objectives in the Hornet's Nest mission in Stalker 2 .

item.title: Gamer Finds Massive Black Ops 6 Discount at Costco
item.description:
Summary

  • Costco is selling PS5 copies of Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 for just $19.97, though it's not clear if that's available in all locations.
  • GameStop offered the game for $34.99 with additional discounts for Rewards members.

A copy of Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 , the latest entry in Activision's popular series of action-packed military shooters, can be picked up for as low as $20 over at their local Costco, a gamer discovered. Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 launched to mostly positive reviews on October 25.

Plenty of games received steep discounts recently thanks to holiday sales. Xbox's ongoing 2024 Countdown Sale significantly brought down the prices of some of the year's biggest releases, including Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 , Dragon's Dogma 2 , and Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 . The latter title's Sony PlayStation 5 version, however, can apparently be obtained for an even lower price, as long as you have access to Costco.

In a recent Reddit post, user argothewise pointed out that a Costco branch in Florida has been selling PS5 copies of Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 for just $19.97 apiece. An Xbox version was available at the Winter Park warehouse as well, according to argothewise, but its price was not mentioned. The Standard Edition of Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 usually goes for $69.99 on the respective online stores of Sony and Microsoft. Its lowest recorded US price on Steam was $52.49, according to data provided by analytics tracker SteamDB.

Costco Offers Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 For Just $19.97

Other retailers have offered Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 at a heavily discounted price as well. A past GameStop deal halved Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 's price, giving people the opportunity to buy the Activision-published title for $34.99. Members of the company's paid rewards program could have saved another $2 if they purchased a used copy thanks to a benefit that guarantees a flat 5% discount on all pre-owned products.

Activision's long-running shooter franchise seems to be struggling to maintain its playerbase, at least on PC. SteamCharts data shows that Call of Duty lost more than 62,000 players on the Valve-owned platform a month after the release of its latest entry. This was observed after Activision's parent company, Microsoft, labeled Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 's launch as the biggest in the series' history.

The first season of Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 added several new multiplayer maps, weapons, and skins to the game. It also introduced a fresh Zombies map, Citadelle des Morts, and marked the return of the Christmas-themed CODMAS event. Reloaded, the latter half of Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 's Season 1, is expected to wrap up on January 28, 2025.

item.title: Call of Duty Images Show the M16 in Each Main Series Game
item.description:
Summary

  • The M16 assault rifle has consistently appeared in various Call of Duty games over the years, including different variants and attachments.
  • A passionate fan shared a collection of images showcasing the evolution of the M16 rifle in mainline Call of Duty entries, sparking discussions among fans.
  • Players can customize their weapons in Call of Duty games with attachments, camos, decals, and charms, allowing for unique loadouts tailored to their preferences.

Offering a comprehensive look at one of the more popular weapons in Call of Duty games, one passionate fan has shared a collection of pictures depicting the many iterations of the M16 rifle throughout the history of the franchise. From old entries like Call of Duty: Black Ops to newer ones like Modern Warfare 3 , the M16 has appeared in the Call of Duty series on several occasions.

Since its inception in 2003, Call of Duty has grown by leaps and bounds, becoming one of the most recognizable names in gaming. Thanks to its smashing success, 2024's Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 further raised the bar for Activision's long-running IP and broke multiple series records. Being an FPS franchise, guns are naturally a key part of all Call of Duty games, and some of these weapons have grown to become favorites of longtime players. The M16 assault rifle is one such weapon that has been consistently present in Call of Duty throughout the years. Besides the standard version, the M16 comes in two different variants, the M16A1 and M16A4.

Recently, a Call of Duty enthusiast compiled images of the M16 appearing across various mainline Call of Duty entries, sparking a discussion among fans on Reddit. The screenshots give glimpses of the M16 versions featured in Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare , Black Ops 3 , Black Ops Cold War , and more. While most of the images give a look at the stock M16, a few others depict the popular assault rifle equipped with certain attachments, including a burst mod. The compilation allows players to identify the minor changes that took place in the M16 rifle's appearance over multiple Call of Duty games. These differences revolve around things like slight design tweaks, external markings, and varying degrees of visible wear-and-tear on the weapon.

Call of Duty Fan Creates Montage of M16 Rifles in Mainline Games

On the CallOfDuty subreddit, user EXTIINCT_tK's virtual picture gallery of M16 rifles started an interesting conversation among members of the community. Several users participated with comments about their favorite version of the M16 in Call of Duty so far. One of them said that the original Modern Warfare 2 's M16 was "the best" in their opinion, whereas another user expressed their preference for the M16 equipped with the grenade launcher attachment, saying that the combo "rules." One user also gave a shout-out to the "OG Skullcrusher," which can be obtained by upgrading the M16 via the Pack-a-Punch machine found in Call of Duty 's Zombies maps.

In addition to letting players pick their favorite loadout, Call of Duty games enable them to customize their weapons to their liking. With a wide variety of attachments, camos, decals, and charms available, Black Ops 6 also provides players the tools to create some unique-looking weapons tailored for their needs.
